children.text:
852 
WGUS84 KTSA 270123
FLSTSA
FLOOD STATEMENT
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE TULSA OK
823 PM CDT Wed Apr 26 2017


...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in 
Oklahoma...

  Caney River near Collinsville affecting Rogers and Tulsa Counties. 
  
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in 
Oklahoma...

  Illinois River near Watts affecting Adair and Delaware Counties. 
  
  Illinois River at Chewey affecting Adair...Cherokee and Delaware 
  Counties. 
  
  Illinois River near Tahlequah affecting Cherokee County. 
  
OKC001-041-270923-
/O.CON.KTSA.FL.W.0017.000000T0000Z-170428T0614Z/
/WTTO2.1.ER.170427T0042Z.170427T0600Z.170428T0014Z.NO/
823 PM CDT Wed Apr 26 2017

The Flood Warning continues for
  The Illinois River near Watts.
* until late Thursday night, or until the warning is cancelled.
* At  7:00 PM Wednesday, the stage was 12.48 feet.
* Flood stage is 13.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The Illinois River near Watts is expected to rise above 
  flood stage this evening and continue to rise to near 16.9 feet by 
  Thursday before dawn. The river is expected to fall below flood 
  stage Thursday evening.
* Impact...At 17.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs from the Arkansas 
  border to Fidler's Bend. Farmlands and permanent campgrounds are 
  affected. A few cabins in the Fidler's Bend area may have minor 
  flooding. Extreme turbulence makes the river too hazardous for 
  floating.
 
&&
 
LAT...LON 3619 9474 3615 9453 3607 9453 3611 9472

$$

OKC001-021-041-270922-
/O.CON.KTSA.FL.W.0018.170427T0738Z-170428T1249Z/
/CWYO2.1.ER.170427T0738Z.170427T1800Z.170428T0649Z.UU/
823 PM CDT Wed Apr 26 2017

The Flood Warning continues for
  The Illinois River at Chewey.
* from late tonight to Friday morning, or until the warning is 
  cancelled.
* At  7:15 PM Wednesday, the stage was  7.69 feet.
* Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The Illinois River at Chewey is expected to rise above 
  flood stage Thursday before dawn and continue to rise to near 14.3 
  feet by early Thursday afternoon. The river is expected to fall 
  below flood stage Friday before dawn .
* Impact...At 15.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs from near Fidler's 
  Bend to near Hanging Rock. Moderate flooding of agricultural lands 
  may result in livestock issues. Travel around Hanging Rock is 
  impacted. Road access near the river is cut off to residential 
  homes southeast of Chewey Bridge. Access to Winset Hollow is cut 
  off. A few cabins in the Fidler's Bend area may have minor 
  flooding. Extreme turbulence makes the river too hazardous for 
  floating.
 
&&
 
LAT...LON 3619 9472 3611 9471 3606 9481 3612 9487

$$

OKC021-270922-
/O.CON.KTSA.FL.W.0019.170427T1145Z-170429T0748Z/
/TALO2.2.ER.170427T1145Z.170428T0600Z.170429T0148Z.NO/
823 PM CDT Wed Apr 26 2017

The Flood Warning continues for
  The Illinois River near Tahlequah.
* from Thursday morning to late Friday night, or until the warning is
  cancelled.
* At  7:00 PM Wednesday, the stage was  7.81 feet.
* Flood stage is 11.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The Illinois River near Tahlequah is expected to rise 
  above flood stage Thursday morning and continue to rise to near 
  14.8 feet by Friday before dawn . The river is expected to fall 
  below flood stage Friday evening.
* Impact...At 15.0 feet, moderate flooding occurs from Hanging Rock 
  downstream towards Tahlequah. Access roads east of the Combs Bridge
  near Eagles Bluff are impassable. Some cabins and parks may begin 
  to flood. Extreme turbulence makes the river too hazardous for 
  floating.
 
&&
 
LAT...LON 3612 9487 3606 9481 3576 9487 3576 9496 3603 9496

$$

OKC131-143-270922-
/O.EXT.KTSA.FL.W.0020.170427T1120Z-170428T0015Z/
/CVLO2.1.ER.170427T1120Z.170427T1200Z.170427T1815Z.NO/
823 PM CDT Wed Apr 26 2017

...Flood Warning extended until Thursday evening...
The Flood Warning continues for
  The Caney River near Collinsville.
* from Thursday morning to Thursday evening, or until the warning is 
  cancelled.
* At  7:30 PM Wednesday, the stage was 24.06 feet.
* Flood stage is 26.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The Caney River near Collinsville is expected to rise 
  above flood stage Thursday morning and continue to rise to near 
  26.1 feet by early Thursday afternoon. The river is expected to 
  fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon.
* Impact...At 26.0 feet, minor lowland flooding occurs.
 
&&
 
LAT...LON 3643 9580 3636 9564 3630 9570 3635 9588

$$
